content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: this was a really fun game XD

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I had fun solving this puzzle, always a love sole game.
The description is clear and easy to understand, this puzzle took me longer than the usual medium ones but it ended up easier than I initially imagined.

Junior to Master are really hard, I cannot resolve them even in my head !!!!
Otherwise, it's a really nice puzzle ????
Can I have some help???

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I meant to approve this several days ago, but I have lost track of time as I sit and watch my code solve these test cases over and over and over. The graphics are pure poetry! The ability to "push" one molecule with another adds a really nice twist to an otherwise straightforward search. I think the medium classification is appropriate, the instructions are clear and the test case progression is solid. Great work!

Once again, great stuff ! At first sight, I thought you could replace the board description with ASCII art but it does not look much simpler actually.
The cell count constraint (<= 6) is wrong. It has a much higher value in some test cases.

Title
* The starting animation in the viewer shows "AntiVirus" but the title is "The Virus". Which one is the actual title?

Introduction
* Please change "shift the cells and molecules" to "shift the molecules".

Rules
* Rule 1: Please add "a" before "unique", and remove "assigned".

* Rule 2: Please add a full-stop.

* Rule 3: Please change "Move" to "In each turn, you may move".

* (The board may also contain): Please change "Molecules" to "Other molecules". Even better if you can think of a more descriptive label (enzymes? nutrients?), but if you do, please add "molecules" before "which you can slide".

* Rule 6: Please add "(except for the exit space)" after "leaves the board".

Loss Conditions
* Point 4: Please change "the dead cell" to "a dead cell".

Initial input
* Please add "2 space-separated integers" before "x y".

Turn input
* Please add "3 space-separated integers" before "moleculeId".

* Please change "specs" to "molecule ID and coordinates".

Output
* Please add "2 space-separated integers" before "moleculeId".

Stub
* Line 3: Please change to:
loop deadCount read x:int y:int

* Line 6: Please change to:
loop cellCount read moleculeId:int x:int y:int

Viewer / Cases
* I haven't reviewed them yet.

Thanks.
Hopefully all resolved. Thanks. Testcases are now ready to test as well. Enjoy
TY. Enjoy :) The constraint is fixed now
Simple BFS + memoization of already visited states should be sufficient without any optimizations even in slower languages. I've passed each testcase below 3.5s

This puzzle requires logical thinking and I was unable to solve it even with a physical copy of the game in front of me. You won't solve it in your head :)

This puzzle is typical BFS puzzle and you can train it on these puzzles
https://www.codingame.com/learn/BFS

If you are not sure what is node and what is edge in BFS:
- Node is game state (where are all the pieces currently on the board)
- Edge is single action you have to take in order to get from NodeA to NodeB

And don't forget to not visit same state twice (memoization)

The choreography of these molecules is visual perfection!

I'm rather embarrassed to admit this, but I spent a chunk of time yesterday trying to do a DFS. I was only solving the first few test cases and I was mesmerized by some of the crazy long paths my molecules would take to reach the exit. I had even seen your tag prior to starting, but for some reason, I just went in a wrong direction.

My Python solution solves everything in less than 200ms except Master and Master (validator). The two Masters require 1500ms each for my Python.

Your maxTurns is often very generous. Is that by design? I'm interested to hear what @5DN1L thinks about this idea, but I'm seeing a Part 2 where maxTurns = minimum possible turns.
maxTurns is indeed very generous. It's about 1.5x higher than minTurns. So it allows DFS, BEAM and a few mistakes

A few things:

>> This puzzle is based on board game named Anti-Virus

Probably needs to be "based on a board game" or "based on the board game".

>> Next cellCount lines: 3 space-separated integers moleculeId x y the molecule ID and coordinates of each cell, where cells with the same moleculeId belong to the same molecule.

The 3 space-separated integers refer to a single cell, so the use of the word "each" doesn't really fit here. How about replacing "each" with "a"?

I see the board game has a "wizard" level. Does the search take too long to include a wizard level test case?

Statement fixed based on your recommendations. TY

About "Wizard" levels: I've only renamed levels... If you solve "Master" testcase here, you solved the hardest (Wizard 60) puzzle.

Thank you. I've tested a bit and it looks fine.

Constraints
* Please change "< unique" to "≤".

* Please delete "s" from "<var>moleculeId</var>s".

* Please change 6 to 8.

* Please change the lower limit of cellCount to 2.

* Please swap the positions of the second and the third constraints.

Referee code
* The condition (output[1] !in moves) appears twice, and the second occurrence can never be reached.

Viewer
* Would it be possible to add coordinate labels to the viewer (similar to the ones in the "visual explanation"), either with or without the option to toggle them on and off?

Thank again.
Thank you! The coordinate overlay looks great. Maybe add a sentence such as "Click the gear icon on the viewer to access extra display options." so that players don't miss the feature?
